title: 109_s2401
content:
The "Alternative Energy Extender Act" includes provisions for energy infrastructure tax incentives, domestic fossil fuel security, and conservation and energy efficiency provisions. It extends credits for renewable resources, clean renewable energy bonds, advanced coal projects, and gasification projects. It also extends the election to expense certain refineries. The "Alternative Energy Extender Act" extends various energy incentives, including credits for renewable resources and electricity production from certain sources until 2011. SEC. 102. Extension and expansion of credit for holders of clean renewable energy bonds. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to extend the termination date to 2010. The national clean renewable energy bond limitation is set at $800,000,000 for bonds issued between 2007 and 2011. The amendments set a national clean renewable energy bond limitation of $800,000,000 for each calendar year. The effective date applies to bonds issued after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 103. EXTENSION AND EXPANSION OF QUALIFYING ADVANCED COAL PROJECT CREDIT. Section 48A(d)(3)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the aggregate credits from $1.3 billion to $1.8 billion. Additionally, the authorization for Integrated Gasification Combined Cycle Projects is expanded with $800 million allocated for such projects and $500 million for other advanced coal-based generation projects. The application period for additional projects under section 48A(d)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended. Applicants must submit applications meeting specific requirements, with $500 million allocated for other advanced coal-based generation technologies and $500 million for integrated gasification combined cycle projects. An applicant can only submit an application for an allocation from specified dollar amounts within a 3-year period. The amendments made by this section will take effect as if included in the Energy Policy Act of 2005. SEC. 104. Extension and expansion of qualifying gasification project credit to $850,000,000. Effective date aligns with Energy Policy Act of 2005 amendments. TITLE II - Domestic Fossil Fuel Security: Extension of election to expense certain refineries. Section 179C(c)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to include qualified refinery property before January 1, 2012. The term 'qualified refinery' is defined as a refinery in the US processing liquid fuel from crude oil or qualified fuels. The amendments made by this section include qualified fuels as defined in section 45K(c) and are effective as if included in the Energy Policy Act of 2005. TITLE III--CONSERVATION AND ENERGY EFFICIENCY PROVISIONS

SEC. 301. EXTENSION OF ENERGY EFFICIENT COMMERCIAL BUILDINGS DEDUCTION. Amends Section 179D(h) of the Internal Revenue Code to extend the deduction until 2010.

SEC. 302. EXTENSION OF NEW ENERGY EFFICIENT HOME CREDIT. SEC. 302. EXTENSION OF NEW ENERGY EFFICIENT HOME CREDIT. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to extend the credit for new energy efficient homes meeting specific requirements acquired after certain dates. SEC. 303 extends the residential energy efficient property credit until 2010. SEC. 304 extends the credit for business installation of qualified fuel cells and stationary microturbine power plants until 2010. SEC. 305 extends the business solar investment tax credit until 2011. TITLE IV extends excise tax provisions, income tax credits, and tariff duties for alternative fuels and vehicles incentives. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to extend biodiesel and alternative fuel incentives until 2010. The ethanol tariff schedule is also updated to take effect on January 1, 2011.
